instructions.start_here: Type or print in black ink.
instructions.additional_info: If you need extra space to complete any section, use the space provided in Part 9. Additional Information.
instructions.copies: Complete and submit as many copies of Part 9, as necessary, with your petition.

11.label: Is your current mailing address the same as your physical address?

physical_address_history.note: Provide your physical addresses for the last five years... Item Numbers 12a. - 13b.

physical_address_2.note: If you answered 'No' to Item 11, provide physical address in Item Numbers 14a. - 15b.

16.label: How many times have you been married?

instructions.address_history: Provide your physical addresses for the last five years, whether inside or outside the United States. Provide your current address first if it is different from your mailing address in Item Numbers 10a. - 10i.
instructions.conditional_physical_address: If you answered 'No' to Item Number 11., provide information on your physical address in Item Numbers 12a. - 13b.

all_previous_spouses.note: Provide information on your current spouse (if currently married) first and then list all your prior spouses (if any).

36.label: I am a (Select only one box):

37.label: My citizenship was acquired through (Select only one box):

38.label: Have you obtained a Certificate of Naturalization or a Certificate of Citizenship?

instructions.spouses: List current spouse first, then all prior spouses. Include date marriage ended.
instructions.parents: Provide information for both parents. If deceased, still include.
instructions.citizenship: Select only one box in Item 36 and Item 37.
instructions.conditional: Show naturalization fields only if applicable.

conditional.note: If you are a lawful permanent resident, complete Item Numbers 40a. - 41.

41.label: Did you gain lawful permanent resident status through marriage to a U.S. citizen or lawful permanent resident?

employment_history.note: Provide your employment history for the last five years, whether inside or outside the United States. Provide your current employment first. If you are currently unemployed, type or print 'Unemployed' in Item Number 42.

part3_biographic_info.note: Provide the biographic information about you, the petitioner.

instructions.lpr_only: Only Lawful Permanent Residents (LPRs) need to fill Class of Admission and marriage-based status.
instructions.employment: Current job first. Use 'Unemployed' if applicable. 5-year history required.
instructions.biographic: Petitioner (you) must fill ethnicity, race, height, weight, eye color.

other_names_used.note: Provide all other names the beneficiary has ever used, including aliases, maiden name, and nicknames.

10.label: Has anyone else ever filed a petition for the beneficiary?
10.note: Select 'Unknown' only if you do not know, and the beneficiary also does not know, if anyone else has ever filed a petition for the beneficiary.

beneficiary_physical_address.note: If the beneficiary lives outside the United States in a home without a street number or name, leave Item Numbers 11a. and 11b. blank.

other_address_contact.note: Provide the address in the United States where the beneficiary intends to live, if different from Item Numbers 11a. - 11h. If the address is the same, type or print 'SAME' in Item Number 12a.

13a.label: Street Number and Name
13a.note: Provide the beneficiary's address outside the United States, if different...

instructions.a_number: Format: A followed by 8 or 9 digits
instructions.unknown_petition: Select 'Unknown' only if both you and beneficiary truly do not know.
instructions.same_address: Type 'SAME' in 12a if U.S. intended address is same as current physical address.
instructions.no_street: Leave 11a and 11b blank if no street address (rural areas).

17.label: How many times has the beneficiary been married?

all_previous_spouses.note: Provide information on the beneficiary's current spouse (if currently married) first and then list all the beneficiary's prior spouses (if any).

family_information.note: Provide information about the beneficiary's spouse and children.

instructions.spouses: List current spouse first, then all prior spouses. Include date marriage ended.
instructions.family: List spouse and all children (biological, adopted, step). Use 'Add More' for additional.
instructions.conditional: Show current marriage place only if currently married.
instructions.relationship: Use: Spouse, Child, Stepchild, Adopted Child, etc.

family_persons_continued.note: Continuation of beneficiary's spouse and children (Persons 4 and 5).

45.label: Was the beneficiary EVER in the United States?

46a.label: He or she arrived as a (Class of Admission):

46d.label: Date authorized stay expired, or will expire, as shown on Form I-94 or Form I-95 (mm/dd/yyyy) or type or print 'D/S' for Duration of Status

49.label: Country of Issuance for Passport or Travel Document

50.label: Expiration Date for Passport or Travel Document (mm/dd/yyyy)

employment_information.note: Provide the beneficiary's current employment information (if applicable), even if they are employed outside of the United States. If the beneficiary is currently unemployed, type or print 'Unemployed' in Item Number 51.a.

53.label: Was the beneficiary EVER in immigration proceedings?

54.label: Select the type of proceedings and provide the location and date of the proceedings.

instructions.entry: Complete only if beneficiary has ever been in the U.S.
instructions.d_s: Enter 'D/S' if Duration of Status (students, etc.)
instructions.proceedings: Check all that apply. Provide location and date.

native_language_name.note: If the beneficiary's native written language does not use Roman letters, type or print his or her name and foreign address in their native written language.

last_address_together.note: If filing for your spouse, provide the last address at which you physically lived together. If you never lived together, type or print 'Never lived together' in Item Number 59.a.

processing_location.note: The beneficiary will not apply for adjustment of status in the United States, but he or she will apply for an immigrant visa abroad at the U.S. Embassy or U.S. Consulate in:
processing_location.note_important: Choosing a U.S. Embassy or U.S. Consulate outside the country of the beneficiary’s last residence does not guarantee acceptance. The U.S. Embassy or U.S. Consulate has discretion over whether or not to accept the beneficiary’s case.

conditional.note: The beneficiary is in the United States and will apply for adjustment of status to that of a lawful permanent resident at the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) office in:

1.label: Have you EVER previously filed a petition for this beneficiary or any other alien?

other_relatives_petitions.note: If you are also submitting separate petitions for other relatives, provide the names of and your relationship to each relative.

instructions.native_script: Use only if beneficiary's language does not use Roman letters (e.g., Arabic, Chinese).
instructions.never_lived_together: Type 'Never lived together' in 59a if applicable.
instructions.consular_processing: Enter city/country where beneficiary will apply for visa.
instructions.lpr_only: Item 61 only for LPR petitioners filing for adjustment.
instructions.previous_petitions: List all prior I-130s, even for other aliens.
instructions.result: Select one: approved, denied, or withdrawn.

relative_2.note: Continuation of other relatives from Page 8.

warning.text: WARNING: USCIS investigates the claimed relationships and verifies the validity of documents you submit. If you falsify a family relationship to obtain a visa, USCIS may seek to have you criminally prosecuted.
warning.penalties: PENALTIES: By law, you may be imprisoned for up to 5 years or fined $250,000, or both, for entering into a marriage contract in order to evade any U.S. immigration law. In addition, you may be fined up to $10,000 and imprisoned for up to 5 years, or both, for knowingly and willfully falsifying or concealing a material fact or using any false document in submitting this petition.

petitioner_statement.note: Read the Penalties section of the Form I-130 Instructions before completing this part.

1a.label: I can read and understand English, and I have read and understand every question and instruction on this petition and my answer to every question.

1b.label: The interpreter named in Part 7. read to me every question and instruction on this petition and my answer to every question in [language], a language in which I am fluent. I understood all of this information as interpreted.

2.label: At my request, the preparer named in Part 8., [preparer name], prepared this petition for me based only upon information I provided or authorized.

declaration_certification.text:
Copies of any documents I have submitted are exact photocopies of unaltered, original documents, and I understand that USCIS may require that I submit original documents to USCIS at a later date. Furthermore, I authorize the release of any information from any of my records that USCIS may need to determine my eligibility for the immigration benefit I seek.

I further authorize release of information contained in this petition, in supporting documents, and in my USCIS records to other entities and persons where necessary for the administration and enforcement of U.S. immigration laws.

I understand that USCIS may require me to appear for an appointment to take biometrics (fingerprints, photograph, and/or signature) and, at that time, if I am required to provide biometrics, I will be required to sign an oath reaffirming that:
1) I provided or authorized all of the information contained in, and submitted with, my petition;
2) I reviewed and understood all of the information in, and submitted with, my petition; and
3) All of this information was complete, true, and correct at the time of filing.

I certify, under penalty of perjury, that all of the information in my petition and any document submitted with it were provided or authorized by me, that I reviewed and understand all of the information contained in, and submitted with, my petition, and that all of this information is complete, true, and correct.

note_to_petitioners.text: NOTE TO ALL PETITIONERS: If you do not completely fill out this petition or fail to submit required documents listed in the Instructions, USCIS may deny your petition.

instructions.statement: Select 1.a. if you read English. Select 1.b. only if an interpreter was used (Part 7 required). Select 2 only if a preparer was used (Part 8 required).
instructions.signature: Must be handwritten in ink. Digital signatures not accepted.
instructions.contact: At least one phone number required.
instructions.warning: Read carefully. False statements are punishable by law.

used.note: Only fill if an interpreter was used to help complete the form.

2.label: Interpreter's Business or Organization Name (if any)

certification.text:
I certify, under penalty of perjury, that:
I am fluent in English and [Language], which is the same language provided in Part 6., Item Number 1.b., and I have read to this petitioner in the identified language every question and instruction on this petition and his or her answer to every question. The petitioner informed me that he or she understands every instruction, question, and answer on the petition, including the Petitioner's Declaration and Certification, and has verified the accuracy of every answer.

used.note: Only fill if someone other than the petitioner prepared this petition.

2.label: Preparer's Business or Organization Name (if any)

instructions.interpreter: Complete only if someone helped the petitioner read and understand the form in a language other than English.
instructions.preparer: Complete only if someone other than the petitioner filled out the form (e.g., attorney, accredited rep, friend).
instructions.signature: Must be original ink signature. Digital not accepted.
instructions.language: Must match language selected in Part 6, Item 1.b.
instructions.conditional: Auto-enable Part 6 checkboxes 1.b and 2 based on whether these sections are filled.

used.note: Only fill if someone other than the petitioner prepared this petition.

7a.label: I am not an attorney or accredited representative but have prepared this petition on behalf of the petitioner and with the petitioner's consent.

7b.label: I am an attorney or accredited representative and my representation of the petitioner in this case [ ] extends [ ] does not extend beyond the preparation of this petition.
7b.note: If you are an attorney or accredited representative whose representation extends beyond preparation of this petition, you may be obligated to submit a completed Form G-28, Notice of Entry of Appearance as Attorney or Accredited Representative, with this petition.

certification.text: By my signature, I certify, under penalty of perjury, that I prepared this petition at the request of the petitioner. The petitioner then reviewed this completed petition and informed me that he or she understands all of the information contained in, and submitted with, his or her petition, including the Petitioner's Declaration and Certification, and that all of this information is complete, true, and correct. I completed this petition based only on information that the petitioner provided to me or authorized me to obtain or use.

instructions.preparer_only: Complete only if someone other than the petitioner filled out the form.
instructions.7a_vs_7b: Check 7.a. if not an attorney/accredited rep. Check 7.b. if you are.
instructions.g28: If representation extends beyond this form, submit Form G-28.
instructions.signature: Must be original ink signature. Digital not accepted.
instructions.contact: At least one phone number required if section used.

pages.note: If you need extra space to provide any additional information within this petition, use the space below. If you need more space than what is provided, you may make copies of this page to complete and file with this petition or attach a separate sheet of paper. Type or print your name and A-Number (if any) at the top of each sheet; indicate the Page Number, Part Number, and Item Number to which your answer refers, and sign and date each sheet.

instructions.use: Only use if you run out of space on any previous page.
instructions.reference: Always include Page #, Part #, Item # you're continuing.
instructions.signature: Each additional sheet must be signed and dated.
instructions.copies: Make copies of this page or attach plain paper with same header.
instructions.a_number: Include A-Number on every sheet if petitioner or beneficiary has one.
